answers.answer: Its not sugar that is the problem its carbohydrates,  your body turns ALL carbohydrates to sugar that is what the digestive system does.  Now eating lower carb and more fat works for many (Low Carb High Fat  LCHF) to help control BG (blood sugar).  the carbs to eat are what is called "Low Glycemic" carbs.  They digest slower and dont raise BG as fast.  IE brown rice instead of white rice. whole wheat instead of white wheat.  and limit portion size will help too.Get a BG meter and test before you eat and 1 hour after you eat.   If your BG goes over 140 (in the USA or over 7.8 in the rest of the world) you eat too many carbs .  eat less carbs or see about medication to help lower BG.Diabetes is controllable,
